Soc.title: Security Incident Response Plan
Soc.details: Our experts will help you assess your existing applications and application designs, identify potential threats, recommendation countermeasures, prioritize defense and make sure they are secure.

points.why: Threat Modelling has become an increasingly important part of Secure software development lifecycle (SSDL)process and has been widely adopted to be an industry security best practice.
points.when:
Optimally, threat modelling should be done at an early stage of the development as it can save significant resources on risk mitigation during a later phase.

Cyber security, threat and technology landscape is constantly evolving, it's also important to perform Threat Modelling on existing systems, applications or features to identify new threats and vulnerabilities.
In the absence of new feature development or enhancement, threat modelling should be revisited as part of support and maintenance activities.
points.headhow: What Methodologies and Tools to Use?
points.how: There are many Threat Modelling methodologies and tools and we'll primiarily use Microsoft STRIDE, Mitre Att@ck, Attack Tree, DREAD and CVSS, etc.
points.who: You. Everyone. Anyone who is concerned about the privacy, safety, and security of their system.

Soc.title: Active Directory Security Breach Response Plan
Soc.details: Our experts will help you assess your existing applications and application designs, identify potential potential abuse cases, recommende countermeasures and make sure your applications are secure.

points.why: Abuse case analysis is an industry security best practice to shift security to the left by identifying potential attackers and abuse cases in design phases.
points.headwhen: When To Perform Abuse Case Analysis?
points.when:
Abuse case analysis as an industry security practice is often used to identify security requirements during design phases.

It can also be used to assess security gaps and vulnerabilities identified by other tools or processes
points.headhow: What Methodologies and Tools to Use?
points.how: We use Threat Modelling methodologies and tools to assist Abuse Case Analysis.
points.who: Everyone with good knowledge of the business use cases and involved technologies can participate and contribute.

Soc.title: PKI Security Breach Response Plan
Soc.details: Our experts will help you define automated and repeatable security test cases to make sure your application stay safe

points.headwhy: Why Automate and Repeat Security Test?
points.why: Traditional penetration test is manual, time consuming and costly and it's infeasible to engage manual penetration test for every signle application release
points.headwhen: When To Automate and Repeat Security Test?
points.when: If your application worths penetration testing and there're potential abuse cases you want to avoid
points.headhow: What Methodologies and Tools to Use?
points.how: Our team have built our own prioperity security test automation solution
points.headwho: Who should Automate and Repeat Security Test?
points.who: Everyone worry about your application security and has concerns on any abuse cases.
